alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 12:07PM EST until January 30 at 10:30AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Newberry, Saluda and Greenwood Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Lexington and Calhoun Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 115.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EST Thursday was 115.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 120.0 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM EST.
